title: Valve used secret memory access “honeypot” to detect 40K Dota 2 cheaters
description: Publisher is publicizing its methods to send a message to would-be exploit users.

title: Meta must pay $175M for patent-infringing livestreaming tech, judge says
description: Texas judge refused Meta's suggestion that maybe it owed no damages.

title: US Copyright Office withdraws copyright for AI-generated comic artwork
description: Zarya images "not protected by copyright." Words and arrangement remain protected.

title: Mozilla says “most top apps” on Android have misleading privacy labels
description: App privacy policies openly contradict the far more visible "nutrition labels."

title: Dealmaster: Best deals on chargers, cables, and batteries
description: Whether you're charging on the go or at home, we've got you covered.

title: Black Mesa gets shiny: Free Half-Life ray-trace mod adds subtle splendor
description: It's free, it's fun, and it makes you appreciate even the most boring hallways.

title: Florida surgeon general fudged data for dubious COVID analysis, tipster says
description: The state closed the investigation, leaving more questions than answers.

title: After defending false data, Comcast admits another FCC broadband map mistake
description: Comcast could have avoided giving false data to FCC by checking its own website.

title: This tool lets you see how much time and money is wasted commuting
description: There's data on 389 different cities across the world, including 80 in the US.

title: Ukraine suffered more data-wiping malware than anywhere, ever
description: Russia has greatly accelerated cyberattacks on its neighbor in the wake of its invasion.

title: Sour fight ends with FDA ruling soy and nut milks can still be called “milk”
description: FDA found that Americans are generally not confused about what's actually milk.

title: Here’s how Mercedes hopes its new OS will give it an advantage
description: Quicker in-car updates and longer vehicle lifecycles are coming, Mercedes says.

title: How Bill Gates’ Minesweeper addiction helped lead to the Xbox
description: Book excerpt: Convincing early '90s Microsoft to sell games was an uphill battle.
